"OBV du fleuve St-Jean – Suivi de température des rivières/River Temperature Monitoring" (dataset). 2.0.0. DataStream. https://doi.org/10.25976/gw70-5705.</gco:CharacterString>

                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Le suivi de thermographes dans certaines rivières dans la portion québécoise du bassin versant du fleuve Saint-Jean permet de documenter des variations dans la température de l’eau. La température est une variable physique qui a un effet sur les communautés biologiques et influe directement sur les facteurs physiques, biologiques et chimiques ayant des répercussions sur les organismes aquatiques.

Deux des sondes ont été financées et installées dans le cadre du programme Des rivières surveillées, s’adapter pour l’avenir - volet Survol Benthos du Groupe d’éducation et d’écosurveillance de l’eau (G3E). Ce programme est soutenu financièrement dans le cadre d’Action-Climat Québec et rejoint les objectifs du Plan pour une économie verte 2030.

--- 

Thermograph monitoring in selected rivers in the Quebec portion of the St. John River watershed documents variations in water temperature. Temperature is a physical variable that affects biological communities and directly influences the physical, biological and chemical factors that impact aquatic organisms.

Two of the probes were financed and installed as part of the program Des rivières surveillées, s’adapter pour l’avenir - volet Survol Benthos of the Groupe d’éducation et d’écosurveillance de l’eau (G3E). This program is financially supported by Action-Climat Québec and is in line with the objectives of the 2030 Plan for a Green Economy.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>
            <gmd:credit gco:nilReason="missing"/>

                    </gmd:keyword>

            </gmd:descriptiveKeywords>

                    </gmd:useLimitation>

---

OBVFSJ assumes no liability for any actions, errors or omissions, use, misuse or results arising from the use of all or part of its data.</gco:CharacterString>
                    </gmd:useLimitation>
                    
                </gmd:MD_LegalConstraints>
            </gmd:resourceConstraints>

            </gmd:language>

            </gmd:topicCategory>

keywords_translation_method.en: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-gw70-5705
notes:
Monitoring thermographs in certain rivers in the Quebec portion of the Saint John River watershed makes it possible to document variations in water temperature. Temperature is a physical variable that affects biological communities and directly affects the physical, biological, and chemical factors that impact aquatic organisms.

Two of the probes were funded and installed as part of the Watched Rivers, Adapting for the Future program - Benthos Overview component of the Water Education and Ecomonitoring Group (G3E). This program is financially supported under Action-Climat Québec and meets the objectives of the 2030 Plan for a Green Economy.

--- 

Thermograph monitoring in selected rivers in the Quebec portion of the St. John River watershed documents variations in water temperature. Temperature is a physical variable that affects biological communities and directly influences the physical, biological and chemical factors that impact aquatic organisms.

Two of the probes were financed and installed as part of the program Monitored Rivers, Adapting for the Future - Benthos Overview component of the Water Education and Ecomonitoring Group (G3E). This program is continuously supported by Action-Climat Quebec and is in line with the objectives of the 2030 Plan for a Green Economy.

notes_translated.fr:
Le suivi de thermographes dans certaines rivières dans la portion québécoise du bassin versant du fleuve Saint-Jean permet de documenter des variations dans la température de l’eau. La température est une variable physique qui a un effet sur les communautés biologiques et influe directement sur les facteurs physiques, biologiques et chimiques ayant des répercussions sur les organismes aquatiques.

Deux des sondes ont été financées et installées dans le cadre du programme Des rivières surveillées, s’adapter pour l’avenir - volet Survol Benthos du Groupe d’éducation et d’écosurveillance de l’eau (G3E). Ce programme est soutenu financièrement dans le cadre d’Action-Climat Québec et rejoint les objectifs du Plan pour une économie verte 2030.

--- 

Thermograph monitoring in selected rivers in the Quebec portion of the St. John River watershed documents variations in water temperature. Temperature is a physical variable that affects biological communities and directly influences the physical, biological and chemical factors that impact aquatic organisms.

Two of the probes were financed and installed as part of the program Des rivières surveillées, s’adapter pour l’avenir - volet Survol Benthos of the Groupe d’éducation et d’écosurveillance de l’eau (G3E). This program is financially supported by Action-Climat Québec and is in line with the objectives of the 2030 Plan for a Green Economy.
notes_translated.en:
Monitoring thermographs in certain rivers in the Quebec portion of the Saint John River watershed makes it possible to document variations in water temperature. Temperature is a physical variable that affects biological communities and directly affects the physical, biological, and chemical factors that impact aquatic organisms.

Two of the probes were funded and installed as part of the Watched Rivers, Adapting for the Future program - Benthos Overview component of the Water Education and Ecomonitoring Group (G3E). This program is financially supported under Action-Climat Québec and meets the objectives of the 2030 Plan for a Green Economy.

--- 

Thermograph monitoring in selected rivers in the Quebec portion of the St. John River watershed documents variations in water temperature. Temperature is a physical variable that affects biological communities and directly influences the physical, biological and chemical factors that impact aquatic organisms.

Two of the probes were financed and installed as part of the program Monitored Rivers, Adapting for the Future - Benthos Overview component of the Water Education and Ecomonitoring Group (G3E). This program is continuously supported by Action-Climat Quebec and is in line with the objectives of the 2030 Plan for a Green Economy.
